alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:38PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A several strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Coconino County and eastern Yavapai County through 415 PM MST... At 335 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Munds Park, or near Sedona, moving south at 10 to 15 mph near I-17 and Highway 89A. HAZARD...Winds up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedona, Munds Park, Village At Oak Creek, Page Springs, Kachina Village, Slide Rock State Park, Stoneman Lake, Mountainaire, Cornville, and Red Rock State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 303 and 336. State Route 179 between mile markers 303 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 359 and 398. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rainfall will cause hazardous driving conditions, due to reduced visibility and slick roads.
